content.description: Sit start on the two big jug/corners under the nose-like protrusion. Match on a sharp intermediate jug and then up to great slopers on top of the 'tip of the nose'. Work your way up the slab and top out behind the 'ear' of the climb.Â
content.location: 'Old Man of Thorns' boulder. Take your first right coming from the North St parking lot, and follow the blue blazed trail to the north-east corner of the park. There's a place where the blue blaze trail turns 90 degrees left but if you walk straight for 10 yards you're on a new trail with a fence line.. If you follow the fence line, make a right through a break in the fence where Babcock Preserve becomes the Greenwich Land Trust Westfall and the boulder is right there on your right and can't be missed.

content.description: Sit start on the far right side of the overhanging west face with hands on the small shelf. Move up to pretty good right hand side pulls and a shitty left hand sloper. Solid holds up and left help you gain the lip and then a relatively easy if heady top-out from there.
content.location: Sit start where the west face meets the southwest face

content.description: Good sized boulder with a lot of interesting features on the northeast side of the park overlooking a beautiful Greenwich mansion. Sit starts, overhangs, mantles, I think there's really a lot of potential here, especially once the mossy slab is scrubbed so that the low overhanging sit start routes can be topped.
